titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Slee Lecture Recital Recordings, 1957-1975
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by John Bewley.

publicationstmt.publisher: State University of New York at Buffalo. Music Library
publicationstmt.p: © 2018. State University of New York at Buffalo. All rights reserved.

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded in EAD by John Bewley.

did.head: Collection Overview

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: State University of New York at Buffalo. Music Department

did.physdesc: 94 reel to reel tapes (15 linear feet)
did.langmaterial: Spoken word content in collection in English.

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: State University of New York at Buffalo. Music Library

did.abstract: The collection of Slee Lecture Recital Recordings contains 94 reel to reel tapes of lectures by the named Slee Visiting Lecturer in the Music Department at the State University of New York at Buffalo.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Specified item], Slee Lecture Recital Recordings, 1957-1975, Music Library, The State University of New York at Buffalo.

accessrestrict.head: Terms of Access and Use
accessrestrict.p: Materials can be examined by qualified researchers in the Music Library during hours of operation during which Music Librarians are present. In order to insure access, researchers are advised to contact the Music Library in advance of visits.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: Copyright for the materials in the collection does not reside with the Music Library. Therefore, patrons wishing to publish any item, or part of an item from this collection for any purpose, are responsible for securing requisite permissions.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of Music Department, State University of New York at Buffalo.

accruals.head: Accruals and Additions
accruals.p: No further accruals are expected to this collection.

altformavail.head: Alternate Forms
altformavail.p: The reel to reel tapes were reformatted to cassettes sometime in the 1970s or 1980s. It is possible that when these transfers were made, they were done in such a way that any musical works presented within a lecture were separated out to stand on their own rather than transferring the entire lecture-recital in its original presentation order. The cassettes have been retained for this reason.

The reels of tape were also digitally reformatted. The preservation files were stored on a hard drive and CD audio discs were created as service copies. However, on the service copies there may not be a one-to-one correspondence between musical works or lectures to discrete tracks or audio files.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Frederick Caldecott Slee was born 25 September 1870 in Skaneatles, New York. He studied music at Harvard while earning his undergraduate degree there. He was a violist and a composer of more than three dozen works. His wife Alice and he bequeathed funds to the University of Buffalo to establish an annual concert series at the University of the entire cycle of Beethoven's string quartets, an ongoing musical tradition in Buffalo. They also designated funds to be used to pay renowned composers or music theorists to come to the University as the Slee Visiting Professor in Music. The chief component of the teaching obligation was to present public lecture recitals, the topics and programs of which were to be determined by the visiting professor. The resulting Slee Lecture Recitals took place 1957-1975. The fund was later shifted to be used for a Slee Chair position in music theory within the department rather than funding visiting faculty.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection of Slee Lecture Recital Recordings contains 94 reel to reel tapes of lectures by the named Slee Visiting Lecturer in the Music Department at the State University of New York at Buffalo. There were 76 lecture-recitals presented and approximately 277 works programmed. Unfortunately, not all programs or works were recorded.

Lecturers included Aaron Copland, Leon Kirchner, Carlos Chavez, Ned Rorem, David Diamond, Allen Sapp, Haieff, Leo Smit, Virgil Thomson, George Rochberg, Mauricio Kagel, Luciano Berio, Daniel Pinkham, Henri Pousseur, Lejaren Hiller, Istvan Anhalt, Nicholas Nabokov, Morton Feldman, Luis De Pablo, Harrison Birtwistle, and Betsy Jolas.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is chronologically arranged by event.

note.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the Library's online catalog.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Resources in the Music Library

defitem.label: Slee Lecture Recitals Catalog, 1957-1976 Mus. Arc. 62
defitem.item: This is the HTML inventory of the cassette collection but includes all programmed works, even if not recorded. Currently there is a link to summaries of some of the lectures.

defitem.label: Slee Visiting Professor in Music Papers, 1957-1993 Mus. Arc. 22
defitem.item: The collection chiefly consists of correspondence between thirty-two composers being considered or invited to fill the position of Slee Visiting Professor in Music at the State University of New York at Buffalo. It also contains clippings pertaining to the composers.
